alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:31AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craig, northern Delaware, southern Ottawa and northeastern Mayes Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles east of Narcissa to 2 miles southeast of White Oak. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Jay... Grove... Fairland... Afton... Langley... Welch... Bernice... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Bluejacket... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... Honey Creek State Park... Cherokee State Park... Bernice State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... White Oak... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 275 and 303. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
